scheme_name: Adi Dravidar and Tribal Welfare Department: Scholarship-Free Education up to 12th Std. to All
description: The Adi Dravidar and Tribal Welfare Department in Tamil Nadu provides free education up to the 12th standard for students from Scheduled Castes (SC) and Scheduled Tribes (ST) communities. The scheme aims to ensure access to quality education and reduce financial barriers for SC/ST students.
key_features: Free education for SC/ST students up to 12th standard
Covers tuition fees and other educational expenses
Implemented by the Tamil Nadu Adi Dravidar and Tribal Welfare Department
Promotes educational equity for marginalized communities

benefits.coverage: Full tuition fees, books, uniforms, and other school expenses

education_criteria: Must be studying in government or government-aided schools
additional_criteria: Applicant must belong to Scheduled Castes (SC) or Scheduled Tribes (ST) as per Tamil Nadu government norms
Must be a resident of Tamil Nadu
eligibility.admission_requirement: Enrolled in government or government-aided schools
institution_criteria: Government or government-aided schools in Tamil Nadu

steps: Apply through the school or Adi Dravidar and Tribal Welfare Department
Submit application form with required documents
Verification by school or department authorities
Benefits provided directly to the school or student
application_process.note: Contact school or department for application process

special_notes: Covers only government or government-aided schools
Hostel facilities may be provided for eligible students
